publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1025# Christine Grahame: Cashmere in Crisis—That the Parliament notes the continuing threat to the Borders cashmere industry which puts at risk 2000 jobs directly and 40 companies with current orders worth £21 million; is not satisfied that all measures have been taken by Her Majesty’s Government through the European Commission to resolve the recurring trade dispute, and urges the Scottish Executive to convey this message in the strongest possible terms to Her Majesty’s Government. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr John Swinney*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Alex Neil*, Brian Adam*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1025# Cashmere in Crisis (lodged on 20 June 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-1025# Cashmere in Crisis (lodged on 20 June 2000) Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1025# Christine Grahame: Cashmere in Crisis—That the Parliament notes the continuing threat to the Borders cashmere industry which puts at risk 2,000 jobs directly and 40 companies with current orders worth £21 million; is not satisfied that all measures have been taken by Her Majesty’s Government through the European Commission to resolve the recurring trade dispute, and urges the Scottish Executive to convey this message in the strongest possible terms to Her Majesty’s Government. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John Swinney, Ms Margo MacDonald, Alex Neil, Brian Adam, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-1025# Cashmere in Crisis (lodged on 20 June 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Colin Campbell*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1025# Cashmere in Crisis (lodged on 20 June 2000) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1025# Cashmere in Crisis (lodged on 20 June 2000) Michael Matheson*

Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John Swinney, Ms Margo MacDonald, Alex Neil, Brian Adam, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-1025# Cashmere in Crisis (lodged on 20 June 2000) Ms Sandra White*
